name: places/ChIJv2EZpCdawokRYMRrtHK0bhg
formattedAddress: 102 Mott St, New York, NY 10013, USA
adrFormatAddress: 102 Mott St, New York, NY 10013, USA

originalText.text: Have used this pharmacy for many years now. As a person with a lot of medical issues and medications I’m very pleased with their excellent service. The pharmacist Mona that I deal with most if I have questions is excellent she is very knowledgeable about the medication and side effects and can explain so I understand, she also take the time to call my physicians if I need a new refill or change of medication or dose if something is not available. This service is something I never experienced at any other pharmacy. The girls in the front are also excellent and very accommodating. Can really recommend this pharmacy to everyone.

originalText.text: No good. I am over 65 years old. Today, I went to the pharmacy at 102 Mott St. NY New York to exchange something from my OTC. The staff are rough. Moreover, they request I change to another pharmacy. I hope the pharmacy manages give staff more professional ethics training.

text.text: No good. I am over 65 years old. Today, I went to the pharmacy at 102 Mott St. NY New York to exchange something from my OTC. The staff are rough. Moreover, they request I change to another pharmacy. I hope the pharmacy manages give staff more professional ethics training.

originalText.text: Despite being a patient for them for over 9 years, they refused to fill one  of my important medications for fungus on the scalp because it didn't pay well enough for them.  Ridiculous . Will never recommend this pharmacy to anyone in my family or any of my friends.

text.text: Despite being a patient for them for over 9 years, they refused to fill one  of my important medications for fungus on the scalp because it didn't pay well enough for them.  Ridiculous . Will never recommend this pharmacy to anyone in my family or any of my friends.

originalText.text: Unless dire need for medical supply: it would be the only reason I would come here again. They only care for their Medicare otc benefits patients at the front register. I was on line to pay for my item as were the four or so people behind me on line. The cashier decides to process the person who literally just came into the store for his otc benefits. (can't mistake the blue/orange cards). I speak up and they tell me to wait till after they do his benefits.  Apparently any other business is extra for them.

originalText.text: I love this pharmacy so much. The workers are so so nice to me. I always get my medicine here. This place is good. My old pharmacy was very bad. They make me od. This one is vv good. It’s also vv sanitized inside. Also the owner’s daughter is very pretty. I like her very much.
